body.paragraph: The input() function allows the program to ask the user for input. The prompt that is included will be displayed to the user before asking them for input.
The below example with ask the user's name and print it to the console.
NOTE: The value returned by the input() function is always text and has to be cast to other datatypes if you are expecting anything other than a text.

body.example:
name = input("Hi! Whatâ€™s your name?")
print(name)

tooltip.title: Ask User for Textual Input
tooltip.body: Displays a message that prompts the user to enter some text. The entered text will be returned.
